post_info.post_title: If you dont believe in your sense then enlarge them

whoa...
 I didnt understand half of your post but the other half I found intriguing enough to post a reply. Are you exaiming the possiblity of Jesus and his disciples being just a bunch of guys tripping out? Thats an interesting perspective. Next, I totally agree with you about the many uses of drugs. I also feel drugs are tools that can be used for enlightenment and inspiration. But like any tool, drugs can be used to hinder and sabatoge. A hammer can be used to build a house or to smash somebody's skull in. The choice is up to the user. 
 PEACE

I encourage everyone to visit http://www.erowid.com, a website for the responsible use of pschoactives. The many vaults contain experiences and information regarding safety, identification, dosage, extraction, legality, etc... on all the known pschoactives. I to agree that when used wisely drugs can enlighten and help you to see your mind in a different way. It is all about the perspective and when used responsibly they can be very entertaining. 
 
 Remember, know your body, know your mind, know your dose.

Well, they used to. Not any more since cocaine is illegal.

Ninjita
 Thats a great site you recommended. It full of very complete and very impartial information (traits that are very rare in the illicit drug world). Thanks for posting it. I have a question though. Im sure we could all agree that pot, shrooms, peyote, organic opiates, and most other naturally occuring drugs should be legalized. But what about drugs like meth, MDMA, and LSD? Should these drugs be legalized as well?

Personally, I believe that with responsibility one could experiment with any drug and that it should be legal. However, the majority of the world is rather irresponsible and the addiction that goes along with many drugs only decreases the user's responsibility. Heroine, for instance, is supposedly the greatest experience in the world and if you're looking to try it only once and have some self control than i think it would be a good experience. But...I've heard of people becoming full blown addicts after only 2 experimentations. My uncle has recently lost his family, his wife, and is now in rehab because it has such a strong hold on him. 
 
 This would be common place if it were legal, you've heard of China's widespread addiction to Opium, it caused the downfall of an entire culture. 
 
 It all revolves around responsibility, if you are responsible and can say no to some things then experimentation is a good way to broaden your horizens and look at life through different eyes. 
 
 Theoretically anything can be done with responsibility, but some drugs make even the most willful responsible people craving addicts. I am and have always been against synthetic substances such as X, PCP, Meth, Heroine, etc... Mainly because of the ease of addiction. Acid, however, isn't as addictive and could be used responsibly. If many of these drugs were to become legal, there would have to be strong laws regarding the use because you often become a different person under the influence. Logical reasonable desicions are void when you are taking shrooms, for example, that's why you should only take them in a safe environment with a sitter. People are irresponsible so you'd have people tripping nuts behind the wheel of a car, walking the streets, etc...
 
 Take it one step at a time, Marijuana being illegal for example is a straight up waste and it should be the first to be legalized.
 
 Some drugs are for the few that can handle them. Poets, philosophers, we would not have some of their creative and intuitive works we do today had it not been for experimentation. 
 
 Remember, always stay open minded, drugs arent for everybody.
 
 Ninjita Con Ganjita :)
